keyTakeAways: A bomb exploded outside the home of Italian investigative journalist Sigfrido Ranucci in Campo Ascolano, 30 kilometers south of Rome.
The device was rudimentary, likely made from firework explosives, and planted outside the front gate of his residence.
Ranucci and his daughter’s cars were severely damaged, but no one was injured.
Ranucci has been under police protection for years due to multiple threats, including bullet threats.
The explosion occurred shortly after he returned home, suggesting a possible link to his investigative reporting.
Anti-Mafia prosecutors have opened an investigation into the incident, citing criminal damage with mafia-style aggravating circumstances.
Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni condemned the act as intimidation and emphasized the importance of free and independent journalism in democracies.
Interior Minister Matteo Piantedosi announced an increase in police protection for Ranucci.

Ranucci’s program 'Report' has frequently clashed with Meloni’s government, leading to legal actions by several government figures, including Finance Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti and Industry Minister Adolfo Urso.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A bomb exploded outside the home of Italian investigative journalist Sigfrido Ranucci in Campo Ascolano, south of Rome, damaging his car and his daughter’s car while leaving no injuries. Ranucci, who hosts RAI’s influential program 'Report,' has long faced threats, including bullet threats, and has been under police protection. The incident occurred about 20 minutes after he returned home, raising concerns about a possible connection to his investigative reporting. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni condemned the act as intimidation, emphasizing the importance of press freedom in democracies. Interior Minister Matteo Piantedosi announced increased police protection for Ranucci. Anti-Mafia prosecutors have launched an investigation into the attack, citing mafia-style methods. The 'Report' program has frequently clashed with the current government, leading to legal actions by several ministers and political allies of Prime Minister Meloni, highlighting deep political tensions between media and government in Italy.
title: Bomb explodes outside home of top Italian investigative journalist
